replies.body:
Insults are not banter.

Telling people to kill themselves is _absolutely **not** banter_.

You were permanently banned for insulting other players, and telling players to kill themselves. Neither of those behaviors are allowed, _especially_ encouraging self-harm/suicide.

Encouraging self-harm normally results in a 14-day suspension from the gate, assuming no prior punishment history, but clearly, you've had punishments before, and consequently, the only natural escalation was a permanent ban.
i never told anyone to kill themselves i said kys as in keep yourself safe, people have kys in their name and play on a normal basis, why aren't they banned? lol

What use is it to lie to a group of people who have no say regardless?

Or was it more for yourself, to try one last time to pretend you're not taking things to unacceptable extremes?

> i never told anyone to kill themselves i said kys as in keep yourself safe...

Yeah, no. You don't get to dictate what you mean by the initialism, much less when your chat log is riddled with insults.

You told people to kill themselves.

> people have kys in their name and play on a normal basis, why aren't they banned? lol

Well, did you report them? If so, then the IFS will look at their behavior/screennames and punish accordingly.

But their behavior and punishment is irrelevant to yours.

Kys is one of the most famous acronyms for "kill yourself" and the luck isn't with you as a lot of people tried justifying saying it with "but it could mean other things". 

Besides that: names containing this need to be reported or reviewed so a name-change will be handed out.

Normally I like to give people on here the benefit of the doubt, but based on the context there it's pretty clear that's not what you meant.

As far as people having kys in their name, report them via support ticket. They'll be forced to change their name and may receive a ban for it, too.
